item.title: TechCrunch Mobility: RIP, Tesla Autopilot, and the NTSB investigates Waymo
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Welcome back to TechCrunch Mobility — your central hub for news and insights on the future of transportation.

item.title: Apple will reportedly unveil its Gemini-powered Siri assistant in February
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: We’re about to get our first real look at the results of the recently announced AI partnership between Apple and Google.

item.title: What is Bending Spoons? The little-known firm behind Vimeo’s sweeping layoffs
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: Bending Spoons remains largely unknown, even as its portfolio of products has served more than a billion people.

item.title: Google says it’s fixed Gmail issues with spam and misclassification
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: If your Gmail account doesn’t seem to be working properly today, you’re not alone.

item.title: Tech CEOs boast and bicker about AI at Davos
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: There were times at this week’s meeting of the World Economic Forum when Davos seemed transformed into a high-powered tech conference.

item.title: Former Googlers seek to captivate kids with an AI-powered learning app
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Sparkli said that education systems often fall behind in teaching modern concepts. The company wants to teach kids about topics like skills design, financial literacy, and entrepreneurship by creating an AI-powered learning "expedition."

item.title: SEC drops lawsuit against Winklevoss twins’ Gemini crypto exchange
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: The Securities and Exchange Commission has dropped its lawsuit against Gemini, the crypto exchange founded by Trump backers Cameron and Tyler Winklevoss.

item.title: A new test for AI labs: Are you even trying to make money?
item.dc:creator: Russell Brandom
item.description: It’s getting hard to tell which AI labs. are actually trying to make money. We created a rating system to help sort it out.

item.title: How PopWheels helped a food cart ditch generators for e-bike batteries
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: PopWheels realized its battery swapping network could be used for more than food delivery workers who need to charge their e-bikes. Now, its planning for an "aggressive rollout" this summer.

item.title: Legal AI giant Harvey acquires Hexus as competition heats up in legal tech
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: Hexus founder and CEO Sakshi Pratap, who previously held engineering roles at Walmart, Oracle, and Google, tells TechCrunch that her San Francisco-based team has already joined Harvey, while the startup's India-based engineers will come onboard once Harvey establishes a Bangalore office.

item.title: Apple iPhone just had its best year in India as the smartphone market stays broadly flat
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Apple shipped a record 14 million iPhones in India in 2025 and gained market share.

item.title: TikTok users freak out over app’s ‘immigration status’ collection — here’s what it means
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: TikTok users are freaking out over a mention of "immigration status" data collection, but lawyers explain the disclosure is related to state privacy laws.

item.title: Who’s behind AMI Labs, Yann LeCun’s ‘world model’ startup
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: Yann LeCun's new venture, AMI Labs, has drawn intense attention since the AI scientist left Meta to found it.

item.title: Waymo probed by National Transportation Safety Board over illegal school bus behavior
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: The NTSB joins the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration in investigating Waymo vehicles illegally passing stopped school buses.

item.title: The Rippling/Deel corporate spying scandal may have taken another wild turn
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: The Department of Justice may be conducting a criminal investigation. This is arguably the biggest drama between two HR startups ever.

item.title: What to know about Netflix’s landmark acquisition of Warner Bros.
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Learn more about Netflix's acquisition of Warner Bros., considered the most historic megadeal in Hollywood, as it continues to develop.

item.title: Researchers say Russian government hackers were behind attempted Poland power outage
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: Security researchers have attributed the attempted use of destructive "wiper" malware across Poland's energy infrastructure in late December to a Russian-backed hacking group known for causing power outages in neighboring Ukraine.

item.title: How did Davos turn into a tech conference?
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo
item.description: The World Economic Forum’s annual meeting in Davos felt different this year, and not just because Meta and Salesforce took over storefronts on the main promenade. AI dominated the conversation in a way that overshadowed traditional topics like climate change and global poverty, and the CEOs weren’t holding back. There was public criticism of trade policy, warnings about AI […]

item.title: Google Photos’ latest feature lets you meme yourself
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: The addition is meant to just be a fun way to explore your photos and experiment with Google's Gemini AI technology, and specifically Nano Banana.

item.title: Meta pauses teen access to AI characters ahead of new version
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Meta today said that it is pausing teens' access to its AI characters globally across all its apps. The company mentioned that it is not abandoning its efforts but wants to develop an updated version of AI characters for teens.
